dict.string: üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Transform your images into WebP format with ease

#!/bin/bash setup_tools=( "brew" "jq" )
for i in "${setup_tools[@]}" do if [[ "$(command -v ${i})" == "" ]] then status="Cannot check cwebp version -> go to the setup toolbox and check Homebrew and jq installation üöß" break fi if [[ "${i}" == "jq" && "$(command -v cwebp)" != "" ]] then online_version="$(curl -s https://formulae.brew.sh/api/formula/webp.json | jq -r '.versions.stable')" local_version="$(cwebp -version)"
if [[ "${online_version}" == "${local_version}" ]] then status="cwebp is up to date ‚úÖ | $local_version" elif [[ "$local_version" != "" ]] then status="Update available ‚ú® | $local_version to $online_version" fi else status="cwebp is not installed ‚ùå | It needs Homebrew to be installed ‚ö†Ô∏è" fi done
if [[ "${the_preset}" != "" ]] then preset_s="$(echo "${the_preset}" | sed 's/,/ | /') ‚úÖ" else preset_s="No preset selected ‚ùå" fi
cat << EOB { "items": [ { "title": "Start the compression", "subtitle": "Run the cwebp compression with your parameters", "arg": "compress", "autocomplete": "Start the compression", "icon": { "path": "rocket-icon.png" } }, { "title": "Presets", "subtitle": "Create, modify or remove presets", "arg": "presets", "autocomplete": "Presets", "icon": { "path": "30F44CB0-C58D-48C6-B23A-AA81E4A3CD16.png" } }, { "title": "CWebP documentation", "subtitle": "Show cwebp documentation", "arg": "doc", "autocomplete": "CWebP documentation", "icon": { "path": "CB9B4DE3-0575-43F8-A28E-3B18C623C590.png" } }, { "title": "CWebP version", "subtitle": "${status}", "arg": "webp", "autocomplete": "CWebP version", "icon": { "path": "webp-icon.png" } }, { "title": "Setup toolbox", "subtitle": "All tools needed for the workflow", "arg": "tools", "autocomplete": "Setup toolbox", "icon": { "path": "1F94198E-A0AE-4609-A7AB-18F2EA5BD61E.png" } } ] } EOB
Convert images in a folder to WebP format easily
Create a new preset by writing preset_name,preset_detail and press Enter ‚Ü©Ô∏è
Set the parameters for the compression

#!/bin/bash arg="{query}"
dirty=$(jq --arg key "$arg" 'del(select(.arg == $key))' ${data_folder}/presets.txt)
clean=$(echo $dirty | sed 's/null//')
jq '.' <<< "${clean}"
Create a new preset by writing preset_name,preset_detail and press Enter ‚Ü©Ô∏è

#!/bin/bash old_preset="${_old_preset}" temp_new_preset="{query}" new_preset=$(jq -R 'split(",") | {title: .[0], subtitle: .[1], arg: (.[0] + "," + .[1]), autocomplete: .[0], icon:{path:"preset-icon.png"}}' <<< "${temp_new_preset}")
jq --arg key1 "$old_preset" --argjson key2 "$new_preset" 'select(.arg == $key1) |= $key2' "${data_folder}/presets.txt"
Modify the preset_name,preset_detail and press Enter ‚Ü©Ô∏è
Modify the preset_name,preset_detail and press Enter ‚Ü©Ô∏è
Write the cwebp options and press Enter ‚Ü©Ô∏è
Select the preset you want to use for the compression or put your own cwebp options
Select a preset or input your options

# üé© Alfred Smart WebP
‚ú® *Transform your images into WebP format with ease* ‚ú®
![workflow](./images/workflow.png)
## ‚úÖ Prerequisite
* üçé MacOS. * üé© Alfred 5. Note that the [Alfred Powerpack](https://www.alfredapp.com/powerpack/) is required to use workflows.
## ‚ÑπÔ∏è information
* üèéÔ∏è Under the hood, the compression is made with [cwebp](https://developers.google.com/speed/webp/docs/cwebp) (made by Google), a tool that allows to compress images into the WebP format, which is generally lighter ü™∂, and broadly used to share images on the web.
## üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Invoke the Workflow
You can invoke the workflow by writing `webp` onto the Alfred search box. You can change this value by changing the `üïπÔ∏è Workflow trigger` variable in workflow configuration panel [optionnal].
## üß∞ Setup the workflow
### üë®‚Äçüíª Install dependencies
#### Open the Terminal of you Mac and run the following commands
1. ‚òëÔ∏è Install Homebrew.
`/bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)"`
2. ‚òëÔ∏è Install cwebp and jq.
`brew install webp | brew install jq`
#### Check your installation under the Setup toolbox of the workflow
![toolbox](./images/toolbox_dark_mode.png)
If something is not installed you'll have the following message :
![jq_not_installed](./images/jq_not_installed.png)
#### CWebP version can be seen in the home menu
![cwebp_home_dark_mode](./images/cwebp_home_dark_mode.png)
‚ú® The workflow is also checking the cwebp version each time you run it.
![cwebp_update](./images/cwebp_update.png)
### üìÇ Data (Presets and Logs) folder
‚ùó This variable cannot be empty. You can change it at your convenience in the workflow configuration panel.
It contains the presets created within the workflow + output logs of the cwebp compression.
üí° Note that if you change the `Data folder` location after creating presets and logs, you should probably move the files created along in the new folder.
![data_folder](./images/data_folder.png)
## ü§ñ Usage of the workflow
### ‚öíÔ∏è Handling presets
Go under the home menu and open the `presets section`.
![presets_home_dark_mode](./images/presets_home_dark_mode.png)
#### Create a preset
Go under the `presets section` and click on "Add a preset".
![add_preset_1](./images/add_preset_1.png)
Add your preset by putting `preset_name,preset_detail`. Note that the comma (`,`) is separating the name of the preset from its content. The content correspond to the cwebp [options] which can be found under the documentation section.
![add_preset_2](./images/add_preset_2.png)
The created preset can be seen under the preset section. New presets are put on top of older ones.
![add_preset_3](./images/add_preset_3.png)
#### Modify a preset
Under the `presets section`, click on "Modify a preset".
![modify_preset_1](./images/modify_preset_1.png)
Select the preset you want to modify.
![modify_preset_2](./images/modify_preset_2.png)
Change its name/value and press enter ‚èé. Don't remove the separator (`,`).
![modify_preset_3](./images/modify_preset_3.png)
#### Remove a preset
Under the `presets section`, click on "Remove a preset".
![remove_preset_1](./images/remove_preset_1.png)
Select the preset you want to remove.
![remove_preset_2](./images/remove_preset_2.png)
### üìñ Check the documentation
Go under the `documentation section` from the home menu :
![docs_home_dark_mode](./images/docs_home_dark_mode.png)
Go to the online documentation or click on one of the options to copy it !
![docs_detail](./images/docs_detail.png)
### üöÄ Start the compression
#### Using Workflow File Filter
Under the home menu, click on "Start the compression".
![start_compress](./images/start_compress.png)
Select the folder with images or directly the image you want to compress and press enter ‚èé.
üí° Note that when selecting a folder, images within subdirectories aren't selected. Only images with `png|jpg|jpeg|tif|tiff|webp` file extensions are selected. In addition, they aren't case sensitive, meaning that the image extension can be `PNG|JpG|tifF...`
![direct_compress](./images/direct_compress.png)
Alternatively, use the `Alfred Buffer` to select folder(s) and image(s) at the same time !! Basic commands are :
* ‚å•‚Üë to add a file to the buffer from Alfred's results. * ‚å•‚Üì to add a file and move to the next item in your list of results. * ‚å•‚Üê to remove the last item from the buffer. * ‚å•‚Üí to action all items in the buffer. * ‚å•‚å´ to remove all items from the buffer.
To know more on how to use `Alfred Buffer`, follow this [link](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/features/file-search/#file-buffer).
üí° Note that `Alfred Buffer` is preferred compare to the `{query}`, meaning that if you select a folder/image (by clicking on it or by pressing enter ‚èé) that is not included in the buffer, **it will not be compressed**.
![alfred_buffer](./images/alfred_buffer.png)
Choose the cwebp options by selecting a preset or input it manually by pressing "Manual options".
![choice_options](./images/choice_options.png)
Check the logs of the compression. To know more on how to read logs, see the `Logs output` section below.
#### Using Alfred Universal Actions
Select the folder(s) / image(s) you want to compress within alfred using `Quick Search` and run `Universal Actions` with ‚Üí or ‚å•‚Üí if you used the `Alfred buffer`. Select "Compress images to WebP".
![universal_action](./images/universal_action.png)
üí° Note that the workflow is type sensitive, meaning that if you select a file that is not part of the following types, the action "Compress images to WebP" will not be available
![types](./images/types.png)
If you want to know more on how to use Alfred Universal Actions, follow this [link](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/features/universal-actions/).
#### Logs output
Check the logs of your compression under the `Data folder`. The log file contains the 2 part.
1. In the orange box there is : * `{date:YYYY/MM/dd}` : Date of the compression with a `YYYY/MM/dd` pattern. * `{time:HH:mm:ss}` : Exact time of the compression with a `HH:mm:ss` pattern. * `user input : {var:_links_list}` : Folder(s) + image(s) path(s) selected with a tab ‚á• separator. * `cwebp options : {var:_the_preset}` : Preset or manual input. Preset will be displayed as `preset_name,preset_detail` whereas manual input will be displayed raw. 2. In the green box there is the `{query}` which correspond to cwebp output.
üí° Note that each compression is separated by a line.
![log_detail](./images/log_detail.png)
¬© Benjamin Oddou
Please submit issues and feature requests at https://github.com/BenjaminOddou/alfred-smart-webp-compression
This folder contains presets and logs outputs
